HBO.title: Trance
HBO.shortSummary: Danny Boyle's twisty thriller about an amnesiac art thief who is probed by a hypnotherapist to find a painting he stole.
HBO.summary: From Oscar(R)-winning director Danny Boyle ('Slumdog Millionaire') comes this twist-filled tale of thievery and deception. James McAvoy is an art auctioneer who plays a key role in the theft of a priceless painting. The only trouble is amnesia is preventing him from telling his partner (Vincent Cassel) where it is. Can sexy hypnotherapist Rosario Dawson get him to remember?

OMDB.Title: Trance
OMDB.Writer: Joe Ahearne (screenplay), John Hodge (screenplay), Joe Ahearne (story)
OMDB.Actors: James McAvoy, Vincent Cassel, Rosario Dawson, Danny Sapani
OMDB.Plot: An art auctioneer who has become mixed up with a group of criminals partners with a hypnotherapist in order to recover a lost painting.
OMDB.tomatoConsensus: As stylish as ever, director Danny Boyle seems to be treading water with the surprisingly thinly written Trance -- but for fans of Boyle's work, it should still prove a trippily entertaining distraction.

OMDB.Title: Wet Hot American Summer
OMDB.Actors: Janeane Garofalo, David Hyde Pierce, Michael Showalter, Marguerite Moreau
OMDB.Plot: Set on the last day of camp, in the hot summer of 1981, a group of counselors try to complete their unfinished business before the day ends.
OMDB.tomatoConsensus: As comedy, Wet Hot American Summer is a slapdash, fragmented affair that misses more often than hits. As parody, it fails because it attempts to satirize something ridiculous and self-parodying in itself.

HBO.summary: Angel of mercy...or Doctor Death? In the 1990s, Dr. Jack Kevorkian became one of the most polarizing figures in modern American history.
